page.title: 14WETHERBY HEALTH CENTRE
page.content: The centre is open five days a week and one hour on Saturday. When closed an answering service puts you through to a doctor. Attached to the centre there are four doctors, four district nurses, three SENs, three health visitors, one practice nurse, two midwives, two school nurses and two family planning nurses. The clinics held are: Family Planning, Ante-Natal, Red Cross, Immunisation, Well Woman, Speech Therapy, Baby Clinic, Audiology and Dietetics. It is obvious that the centre is always busy, with over 100 people attending daily. The main aim is to educate people about keeping fit and healthy and also to screen for early detection of illnesses, so that the necessary treatment can be quickly administered. Small stitching can be done at the centre but anything more serious is sent to the hospital.
